statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Citadel cruises to 83-53 win over North Greenville
article.headline: Citadel cruises to 83-53 win over North Greenville
article.linkText: Citadel cruises to 83-53 win over North Greenville
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Ashton Moore scored 21 points and dished out nine assists as The Citadel topped North Greenville 83-53 Saturday night. Moore hit 3-point shots on three consecutive possessions to cap off an 11-0 run by the Bulldogs midway through the first half which opened up a 21-9 lead. North Greenville (2-3) pulled within eight, 24-32, on a pair of free throws by Chris Dean with 4:29 left in the first half. The Citadel (2-2), however, responded with a 12-2 spurt, capped by another Moore 3-pointer, to close out the first half leading 44-26. The Crusaders opened the second half with an 11-3 run of their own, trimming its deficit to just 12, but the Bulldogs answered with a 12-3 surge, putting the game out of reach. Dean paced North Greenville with 16 points and Micah Parker added 14. Matt Van Scyoc scored 19 in the win.
